The King's Speech is a 2010 British biographical drama film directed by Tom 
Hooper and written by David Seidler. Colin Firth plays King George VI who, to 
cope with a stammer, sees Lionel Logue, an Australian speech and language 
therapist played by Geoffrey Rush.
